intro: Meringium denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed meringium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Meringium denticulatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
